page.title: 04EAGLESCOTT AIRFIELD
page.content: Eaglescott was opened in 1983, and is the home of the North Devon Flying Club.This grass airstrip is owned by Mr.Pearson, chief flying instructor, and Mr.Fraser-Smith.There are about 60 members of Devon Air Sports, which specializes in{gliding,flying light {aircraft and parachuting.}15 people have been trained to be motor glider pilots.For a full pilot's licence they have to have further training at Exeter Airport.In the hangar are planes, gliders, a helicopter and a microlight.The gliders are towed into the air either by a winch up to 1,000 ft. or by small plane to more than 2,000 ft. Young people from Adventure Holiday Centres come for{First Flight {Experience.}This year 2,800 people will come. In addition to flying experience there is archery and grass skiing available.
